ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 hour

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Most benefit from guest lectures.
I didn't learn much new material in this course. Most of it was a repeat of epi I and II, except presented in a far less coherent manner.
informative

This course is required for EHS students but did not teach any information that wasn't taught in Epi 1, Epi 2, and exposure assessment. THe entire course was a review of epi concepts previously learned with a focus on environmental stressors that are all covered in exposure assessment. This course adds nothing to the EHS student's learning experience.

This course is a waste of time for all EHS students and for any student that has taken epi with Dr. Dubrow and assessing environmental stressors with Dr. Leaderer.This course covers material that we are all comfortable with but does so in an unorganized and confusing manner. The material is poorly taught, the presentations are unprofessional (full of typos) and difficult to follow (most lack complete sentences). The professor's assignments lack any real direction, for example homework consist of reading a paper and writing a one page response to the question "do you agree?".I think that this course is unfortunately below the standards of YSPH and it is a shame that EHS students have to waste our time when we could take other course that will teach us something new.
The course covered application of epidemiologic principles specifically for environmental health sciences research. The focus on practical applications was helpful.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Good
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  nice

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  The instructor is hard to understand. His powerpoint slides contain many typos and are also difficult to understand. His exams are hard to understand. It was clear that he made his TA do all of the grading without giving him grading keys or advisement.

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  I think that Dr. Zheng is a very nice and smart guy. It is obvious that he is a talented researcher but unfortunately he is not a good teacher. His English is difficult to follow and i think that his duties prevent him from taking thetime to make this course what it has the potential to be.I think that Dr. Zheng has to revamp this course completely before I can recommend it to any student.

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Dr. Zheng clearly focuses on the practice of environmental health research, which provided insight in the application of the theoretical knowledge of principles of epidemiology I and II.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: OK, not a lot of chance to be helpful

I think that some of the students had a better grasp of the material than the TA did. I suppose he was helpful to the professor, since he graded all our assignments and exams, but there was no benefit to the students.
good
It was clear that the TA and professor did not communicate. The TA did not seem to be knowledgeable enough to be in an assistant position.
Luis was great, I am thankful that he was able to communicate the professor's intentions and thus added perhaps the only real guidance in this course.
The Ta is useless for this course. He did nothing.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I will

I definitely would not recommend this class to another student. Of course, those in the EHS track don't have a choice in the matter, unfortunately for them. It was a waste of time. Some of the guest lecturers were interesting, but most of the course material is already taught (more effectively) in epi I and II.
informative

I would say to a student "do not take this course!". I would recommend epi 2 with Dr. Dubrow and any other EHS course. No useful content is presented in this course, it should not be called environmental epi because we only talk about the environment for 2 weeks. This is a below average course that fails to meet its potential and the standards of YSPH.
This course does not advance anything new, beyond that which was learned in a basic epi 1&2 class

The course is of a much more practical than theoretical nature. Because of this, I would recommend the course to students interested in environmental health research, but not necessarily to those in other divisions.
